title: >>> Out of RETIREMENT
body_text:
HeatWave '07
is rockin' with yet another spine-tingling encounter. Best be sure to check this one out come May 26.
The second of the Triple Main Event ...
May 2006
The one and only Joe Kelly was at the absolute top of his game, conquering the greats of the game one right after the other. This competitive era, often called the 2nd Golden Age of dodgeball, shattered long-standing records and truly brought out the best in every player. One year later, it's only fitting to duplicate, or attempt to anyways, the enormous success of last year's mayhem. The finale event of the month will be quite the show-stealing extravaganza as two of the most recognized, and certainly talented stars come out of retirement in a match lost in time.
May 2007
The long-awaited return of the iconic
Dan Spengeman
has been the talk of the town with questions having remained unanswered.
What ever happened to the dodging and blocking extraordinaire?
Since his horrendous finger incident at DODGEBALL 43 last June, few have seen or even heard from the legendary figure. Sure he's made an appearance from time to time, but he never got back into the swing of things. This up coming 89th spectacular brings the multi-time award winner back onto the court he helped create, even if it's just this once. But another earth-shattering announcement came just weeks later ...
At the back court brawl known as DODGEBALL 87, the dodgeball world was stunned by the news that athletic superstar
Derek Carty
would also return to the dance, facing "QuickSand" Dan in one ultimate and perhaps forgotten match. The fearless and unpredictable high-flyer Carty is more than ready for the challenge as Season 1 icons share the spotlight.
Captains History of Spengeman
The wily veteran has an impressive record heading into this never-before-seen clash. An overall standing of 2-1-0, that one loss came by way of a team attraction at DODGEBALL LX. In singles competition, "Quick Sand" remains unbeaten.
Captains History of Carty
Derek will certainly be looking to turn his luck around with hopes of ending his miserable streak of consecutive losses. Perhaps no one has suffered as much as he, going 0 and 4 during his entire dodgeball career. The agile veteran has everything to gain heading into this match-up.
Dan Spengeman vs. Derek Carty
The final stop on
The Road to 90
________________________________________
________________
Injury Update from DODGEBALL 88
For those who haven't heard, superstar Kevin Adams's right pinky finger is fortunately not broken. But he did tear some ligaments, an injury that will require six months of healing time. Again, we wish the legend a speedy recovery. He has already made it known that he will not be missing any time away from the court, proving his great resiliency and heart.
